comments:
Eclipse is crashing while I'm editing at seemingly random times. It is difficult to isolate because the 
times it has happened was when I was actually editing code and typing.  It renders Eclipse 
somewhat unusable on this machine as it bombs quite often.

I'm running OS 10.2.8 on a new 15AL PowerBook G4.

Here was what I could pull from the system.log:

-- start here --
ct  6 16:09:50 gogumi WindowServer[191]: Reserved range exhausted. (0xbbe79000 to 
0xbc108000 goes out of bounds)
Oct  6 16:09:50 gogumi WindowServer[191]: CGXMapShmem : vm_map(3) : Cannot map memory
Oct  6 16:09:50 gogumi /Users/hseikaly/eclipse_build/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/Eclipse: 
kCGErrorFailure : CGSMapShmem : Cannot map shared memory
Oct  6 16:09:50 gogumi /Users/hseikaly/eclipse_build/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/Eclipse: 
kCGErrorFailure : Failed to create window context device.
Oct  6 16:09:50 gogumi /Users/hseikaly/eclipse_build/Eclipse.app/Contents/MacOS/Eclipse: 
kCGErrorFailure : CGWindowContextCreate: failed to create context.
Oct  6 16:09:50 gogumi WindowServer[191]: Reserved range exhausted. (0xbbe79000 to 
0xbc108000 goes out of bounds)
-- end --

I'm not sure if this is specific, but this is all I can cull from the logs.  Its happened fairly often for 
me, but maybe its a problem running it on these new machines.

Can you please attach Eclipse's log file (<workspace>/.metadata/.log)
If it's too long just attach any suspicious stacktraces from the end.

got info from the log, looks like OutOfMemory errors, but I was running Eclipse without much 
else... Maybe I need to tweak some java settings...

OutOfMemoryErrors shouldn't be crashing the VM.  The timestamp of the errors in
the log are off by a couple of hours from the errors shown in the system log. 
Is there anything in your log that matches the errors in the system log
(16:09:50)?  VMs usually produce a javacore dump file when they crash, but I'm
not sure what this looks like on MacOSX and where to find it...

Created an attachment (id=6351)
Eclipse .log file for this issue.

The attachment is the log file i have from Eclipse.  The system log entries match up to another set 
of errors in the .log file.  But those errors are seemingly the same as those given before.

So both the OutOfMemoryError and the SWT out of handles error occurred during
the same second as the crash.

I'm going to take a case based on the "Reserved range exhausted" message that
it's related to the "out of handles" error, so I'm moving to SWT for further
analysis.

Also CC'ing Philippe from JDT core for the OutOfMemoryError because it occurs in
compiler code (maybe there's a known memory issue there??)

Suspecting Eclipse did not get enough memory on the Java VM to perform 
correctly. Did you specify "-vmArgs -Xmx 256MB" or something like that ?

Would need steps to reproduce.

I didn't run Eclipse with any mem parameters to the vm.  I run it straight out of the box... I could 
try running with some params set for mem.  Otherwise, I couldn't pin down the exactly user action 
that caused the crash.  I was in the middle of typing when they all occurred.

Thx for the info.  I can run the same projects fine without OutOfMemoryExceptions on the out of 
the box win2k version of Eclipse.  But for some reason the same projects do crash on the Mac OS X 
version.  And the windows box I use is a pretty weak machine compared.  Perhaps its also a 
problem with the JVM that is included with Mac OS X (Mac OS 1.4.1)... I will run the command line 
parameters to see if that helps.
SSQ is the trace helpful?  No more handles?

Peter, just some questions:
- do you have any special zip files in your workspace?
   May be a very large one, or one that is corrupted?
- how much memory does your your PowerBook have?
- have you tried to increase the heapsize by editing the Info.plist file in
   Eclipse's application  bundle?

No, i don't have any special zip files in the workspace.  My powerbook has 512 megs of ram... and 
I just increased the heapsize in Info.plist... I will work with Eclipse today and see if that improves 
things.
Are you still having out of memory problems with a bigger heapsize?
I increased the heap and it appeared to have solve the problem for this particular version.

OK, please reopen if you start seeing it again.

Thanks!
Silenio
